data.event: The earliest History of Caldwell is centered on Elmhurst, as there wasn't any village of any size until after 1900.
Elmhurst was operated for years as a stage stop, being only a few yards from the toll bridge over which passed the east and west stage and wagon road.
The Bridge over the Greenbrier river was built in 1821.
The tavern with its extensive acreage was sold in 1848 at auction together with a gristmill in court proceedings of Allen T. Caperton, executor of Henry Erskine's estate v.
